Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • Client

  • public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    Client constants.

    A Client object consists of

    • (boolean) loggedIn
    • (boolean) unreadMessages
    • (String) user

    The Client class handles the operations from the client side of the chat application. First, the client opens a connection to the server to handle user input, then forks a new thread to continuously listen for any new messages or server pings.

    The user is shown textual-based menus to navigate the application. The basic functionality is if a user is not logged in, they may either create an account or log in.

    Once a user is logged in, they may either send a message to another user, check their own messages, list either all users or a subset according to a Java regular expression, delete their own account, or simply end the session.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Client opens a connection to the server via a socket to handle input requests by the user. The client also forks another thread to run concurrently, which continually listens for pings from the server. This enables the Client to display a pop-up notification if any new messages arrive while the user is still logged in.

      • getInput

        public static void getInput(java.net.Socket socket)
        The getInput method receives the socket connection and handles user input.

        Prints a simple textual menu, from which the user selects operations. Users select options by entering the corresponding integer for each menu option. If the user is not logged in, the "Log In Menu" is displayed, from which users may create a new account or log in to an existing account. Users may not create an account with the same name as an already existing account, nor may users log into an account that either does not exist or is already logged in.

        After successful log in, the "User Menu" is displayed. This gives the options

        • Delete Account
        • Send Message
        • Check Inbox
        • List Users
        • End Session

        These options are handled by the subsequent methods in class ClientSend, which help send the data packets to the server to be processed.
